div.p: REPHIDIM (anc. geog.), a ſtation of the Iſrael-ites near mount Horeb, where they murmured for want of water; when Moſes was ordered to fmite the rock Horeb, upon which it yielded water. Here Joſhua dif-comfited the Amalekites. This rock, out of which Moſes brought water, is a ſtone of a prodigious height and thickneſs, riſing out of the ground ; on two ſides of which are ſeveral holes, by which the water ran. (Thevenot.)
